thread.title: Myron Blueford to lead Arizona College Prep football program
thread.title_full: Myron Blueford to lead Arizona College Prep football program

title: Myron Blueford to lead Arizona College Prep football program

organizations.name: scottsdale chaparral baseball | school won division

text:
Myron Blueford to lead Arizona College Prep football program Richard Obert , azcentral sports 6:53 p.m. MT Jan. 9, 2017 Former Phoenix College and Moon Valley defensive coordinator Myron Blueford is looking forward to starting Arizona College Prep's football program. (Photo: Courtesy of Myron Blueford) 
Arizona College Prep is the smallest high school in the Chandler Unified School District with a little more than 400 students. 
But student interest has increased enough for the school to add football beginning next school year. 
Myron Blueford, who was an assistant at Phoenix College this past season and was defensive coordinator at Phoenix Moon Valley for four years, will lead the start of the program. 
"We start all of our programs based on student interest," said Athletic Director Heather Osborn, who is in her third year at the 2A Conference school. "We've had families asking for football since I started. 
"We have successfully added boys volleyball and softball, as well as adding sand volleyball this year based on student demand, and felt that with the success of those programs that we were ready to tackle football." 
Arizona College Prep is about a mile from Chandler High, which has won two of the past three 6A Conference state championships. 
Osborn said there is great support from parents and the district. 
"We are confident that it will be a positive experience and addition for our school," Osborn said. 
Home games will be played at Andersen Junior High, which is preparing to make its field varsity ready. 
"I'm extremely excited to coach in the best football district in the state," Blueford said. "There are really good athletes on campus and I'm sure with adding football and being one of the best academic schools in the state, I anticipate it being an attractive school in the future. 
"There is a tremendous amount of excitement on campus for football. It was an opportunity that most coaches would love. Starting a program at ACP is literally a dream come true." 
Suggest human interest stories to Richard Obert at or 602-316-8827. Follow him at azc_obert Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 30 Arizona high school teams have won at least 10 state titles since 1985. Take a look at each: Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 31 titles since 1985: Phoenix Brophy Prep boys swimming | Has won the state title in the state's largest classification every season since 1980 except for one. (Team finished second to Mesa Dobson in 1987). Bill Doebbler, Bil Kopas and Pat O'Neill have all won titles at the school during that time. 2006 team scored 556 points, the most the team has scored at a state meet. Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 29 titles since 1985: Phoenix Xavier Prep girls golf | The school has won every title in the state in the largest classification since 1985 except for in 2010 and 1997 and 1996. Chandler Hamilton beat the team in 2010 and Phoenix Horizon beat the team in both 1996 and 1997. School also won titles from 1980-1984. Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 27 titles since 1985: Keams Canyon Hopi boys cross country | School most recently won Division IV titles in 2016, 2015, 2014, 2013, 2012 and 2011. Also won the same title in 2010 with 58 points, well ahead of the second place finishers' 111. School won 3A titles from 2001-2006 and 1A/2A titles from 2007-2009 and 1990-2000, all under coach Rick Baker. Mark Henle/azcentral sports 26 titles since 1985: Phoenix Xavier Prep girls swimming | Has won the state title in the state's largest classification every season since 1980 except for five. 2009 squad scored 546 points at state meet. Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 25 titles since 1985: Tucson Sunnyside wrestling | School won Division I title in 2013 with 151.5 points. Also won Division I title in 2011 and took home 5A-II titles from 2006-2010. School also won 5A titles in 1999, 1998, 1996 and from 1985-88. School's 4A titles came from 2000-05 and 1990-94. Bobby DeBerry won 15 titles at the school. Jessie Wardarski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 22 titles since 1985: Keams Canyon Hopi girls cross country | Team took home title in Division IV in 2013, 2012 and 2011. Also won 2010 Division IV title with 31 points under coach Laverne Lomakema. Other titles came in 2003, 2002, 1988, 1987 (3A), 2007-09, 1996-00, 1989-94 (1A/2A). 1990 squad scored just 18 points. Crystal Ochoa/azcentral sports 18 titles since 1985: Chandler Valley Christian girls track | School won 15 straight 2A girls track titles (1996-2010) and 18 of 19 (1992-1994) under coach Dan Kuiper. Highest point total came in 2001 when team got 278 points. Charlie Leight/azcentral sports Fullscreen 16 titles since 1985: Phoenix Xavier Prep girls tennis | School won Division I titles in 2015, 2014, 2013 and 2012. Won four straight titles from 1999-2003. Ellie Conrad coached team to 1998 title, while Jennifer Johnson was the coach for 1997 and 1995 titles. School won 5 straight titles won 1987-1991. Won 2 titles prior to 1985. Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 14 titles since 1985 Phoenix Arcadia girls swimming | School most recently won the Division II title in 2011. Before that, team won the 4A-II title in 2009 with 497 points. Team also took home 4A-II title in 2008, 2007 and 2006. School won 4A titles in 1999, 1998, and 1989-1995. Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 14 titles since 1985: Page boys cross country | School most recently won the Div. III titles in 2016, 2015 and 2014. Under coach Mark Lomeland, school won 4A-II title in 2005 and 4A titles in 2004, 2003, 1992, 1991, 1990 and 1989. Jim Trapp coached team to titles in 1999, 1998, 1997, 1995. 1992 team scored just 27 points to run away with the title. Closest competitor scored 136. Mark Henle/azcentral sports 13 titles since 1985: Tucson Catalina Foothills boys swimming | Won Division II titles in 2014, 2013 and in 2010. Also took home titles in 4A-I from 2005-2009 and in 4A from 2000-2004. Michael Schennum/azcentral sports 13 titles since 1985: Safford girls track | Under Herman Andrews, team won 13 straight 3A titles from 1986-1998. Andrews also led school to titles in 1983 and 1984. The 1991 team scored 268 points. Courtney Pedroza/azcentral sports Fullscreen 13 titles since 1985: Lakeside Blue Ridge football | Paul Moro's team won Division IV titles in 2013 and 2011. He also won titles in 2009, 2004, 2001, 2000, 1997, 1996, 1995, 1994, 1990, 1989 and 1987. 1994-1997 teams all finished 13-0. Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 12 titles since 1985: Flagstaff girls cross country | School won the 2016, 2015, 2013 and 2012 Division II titles. Also won the 2011 Division II title and before that took the 4A-II title in 2008 by eight points over Page. School won 5 straight 4A titles from 2000-04 and also took home 4A title in 1990. Crystal Ochoa/azcentral sports Fullscreen 12 titles since 1985: St. David baseball | School won Division IV title in 2012 over Yuma Catholic. School's last title before that came in 2002 season, when it won its 3rd straight 1A state championship. Also took home 1A titles in 1997 and 1993 and won 6 straight from 1986-1991. Danny Miller/azcentral sports Fullscreen 12 titles since 1985: Phoenix Brophy Prep boys tennis | Under coach Bill Woods, won Division I titles in 2013 and 2012, defeating Tucson Salpointe in 2013 (5-0) and Scottsdale Desert Mountain in 2012 (5-1). Also won back-to-back 5A-I titles under coach Woods in 2009-2010. School also won 8 straight 5A titles under Woods from 1996-2003. David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports 12 titles since 1985: Tucson Catalina Foothills boys tennis | School won back-to-back-to-back Division II titles from 2014-16. Robb Salant coached team to 6 straight 4A-I titles from 2006-2011. School also won 4A titles in 2005 and 1997 and 1989. David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 12 titles since 1985: Tucson St. Gregory boys tennis | Mark Swenson guided team to 1A titles in 2011, 2010, 2009 and 2008. Dale Long was the coach when team won 1A/2A titles in 2000 and 1998. Tom Redman was coach for 1997 title. Team also won titles in 1993, 1991, 1990, 1988 and 1987. Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 12 titles since 1985: Tucson Catalina Foothills girls tennis | Won 2013 Division II title under Kristie Stevens with 5-4 win over Oro Valley Ironwood Ridge. Team also won 4A-I titles under Kristie Stevens in 2011, 2010, 2009, 2007 and 2006 and 4A titles under Stevens in 2005, 2004, 2003, 2002, 2001 and 2000. Sean Logan/azcentral sports Fullscreen 12 titles since 1985: Miami girls tennis | Won Division III title in 2013 under coach Cherry Roberds with 5-3 victory over Phoenix Country Day. Also won 3 straight 1A/2A titles under Roberds from 2002-2004. Roberds also led team to 3A titles in 1999, 1997, 1996, 1995, 1989, 1988, 1987 and 1986. School also won 10 straight 1A/2A titles under Roberds from 1973-1982. Aaron Lavinsky/azcentral sports Fullscreen 11 titles since 1985: Page girls cross country | Most recently won the 2015, 2014 and 2012 Division III titles. Theodore Martin's team beat Chinle by 4 points for the Division III title in 2010. School's other titles came in 2009, 2006, 2005 (4A-II) and 1999, 1998, 1992, 1991 (4A). John Severson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 11 titles since 1985: Tucson Catalina Foothills girls swimming | School won Division II titles in 2013 and 2010. School also won 4A-I titles in 2009, 2007, 2006 and 2005 and 4A titles from 2000-2004. 2009 team scored school-record 450 points at state meet. Pat Shannahan/azcentral sports Fullscreen 11 titles since 1985: Thatcher boys golf | Under coach Dennis Martin, school won six straight 1A/2A titles from 1991-96. Martin also led team to 1989 and 1998 titles. Dale Holladay was coach for 2000 title and Mary Jones led team to titles in 1987 and 1988. Charlie Leight/azcentral sports Fullscreen 11 titles since 1985: Phoenix Northwest Christian girls volleyball | School won Division IV titles in 2013 and 2011. Also won the 2010 2A title with win over Thatcher in the final. Team also won 2A titles in 2007, 2004 and 2003. Other five titles came in 1A with five straight from 1991-1995. Carlos Salcedo/azcentral sports Fullscreen 11 titles since 1985: Phoenix Xavier Prep girls volleyball | Team won Division I title in 2013 over Hamilton in 5 sets under coach Lamar Bryant. Also won 4 straight 5A-I titles from 2007-2010 under coach Tim McHale and 5A-I title in 2005 and 5A title in 2002 under McHale. Terri Cox guided team to title in 2000, while Lisa Olona was the coach for 1998 and 1997 title runs. Susan Contreras coached school to first state title in 1996. Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 11 titles since 1985: Chandler Valley Christian boys track | Won the 2012 Division IV title under coach Dan Kuiper, who also led team to state titles in 2009, 2007, 2005, 2004, 2003, 2002 and 2001. Bernon Benson led school to titles in 1997, 1991 and 1989. Charlie Leight/azcentral sports Fullscreen 10 titles since 1985: Chandler girls track | The Wolves won nine straight state titles from 2006-2014 under coach Eric Richardson. The 2006-1010 titles were in 5A-I. The 2011-14 titles were in Division I. Team most recently won the Div. I title in 2016. Courtney Pedroza/azcentral sports Fullscreen 10 titles since 1985: Chandler Seton Catholic softball | Program has defined greatness at many levels. Jerry Mullin's teams won titles in 2010 and 2009 (4A-II), 2005, 2004, 2003, 2002 (3A), 1999, 1998, 1997 and 1996 (2A). School also won a title in 1983 and 1979. Team has won all of its title game appearances since finishing second in 1982. Crystal Ochoa/azcentral sports Fullscreen 10 titles since 1985: Scottsdale Chaparral baseball | School won Division I title over Brophy in 2012. School won 5A-II title in 2011. Both those titles came under Sam Messina. All 8 previous titles came under coach Jerry Dawson, the last in 4A-I in 2008. Also won 4A-I title in 2006 and won 3 straight 4A titles from 2003-2005. Before that won the 1999 and 2000 4A state titles. Also won state title in 1994. Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 10 titles since 1985: Scottsdale Saguaro football | School won Class 4A title in 2016, Division II title in 2015 and Division III titles in 2014 and 2013, all under coach Jason Mohns. Previously won 2010 4A-I title under coach John Sanders. School also won titles under Sanders in 2008 and 2007. Mike Reardon coached team to 2006 4A-I title and Tim Beck was the coach when team won the 4A title in 1995. Carlos Salcedo/azcentral sports Like this topic?
